description:
At YPrime, we help our clients in the pharma and biotech industries to collect data from patients using mobile devices, assign patients to study treatment groups, and dispense clinical trial drugs and supplies using web apps.  We’re supporting life-altering research, one project at a time.

Is your career in its prime?  It could be!

YPrime’s Innovation & IT team is searching for a Senior Data Engineer. This is a contracting role, with a possibility of full-time conversion in the future.

Does our mission sound like something you can get behind?  If so, here’s what we need from you:
• Advanced Python proficiency – Possess and in-depth knowledge of Python, including libraries such as Pandas and NumPy
• Expertise in SQL – Advanced skills in SQL for complex data querying and manipulation
• Proficiency in DBT – Strong experience in using DBT for data transformation and building
• Familiarity with data testing frameworks to ensure data quality and accuracy
• Experience in developing cloud data pipelines using Python
• Significant experience with large-scale data orchestration using tools like Dagster or similar

Here are some more details about the job:
• You’ll lead the engineering of robust data pipelines, primarily using DBT and Python, within an Azure environment, ensuring efficient data flow and processing.
• You’ll take full ownership of the company's DBT models, overseeing their development, maintenance, and optimization.
• You’ll be responsible for comprehensive data-testing, utilizing both Python frameworks and DBT frameworks to ensure data integrity and reliability.
• You’ll lead the migration of legacy reporting systems from SQL Server to Snowflake using DBT, ensuring a smooth transition and minimal disruption.
• You’ll manage and develop data orchestration processes, utilizing tools such as Airflow, Dagster, or Prefect, to streamline and automate data workflows.
• You’ll work closely with Product and Project teams, contributing to major project architectures and translating strategic goals into actionable plans.
• You’ll interface with legacy systems, integrating them with modern technologies to support large-scale digital, data, and analytics initiatives.
• You’ll uphold high standards for writing secure, reliable code, and foster a collaborative environment as a key team player.

Have these things too? Even better!
• Bachelor’s degree or MBA in Computer Science, Information Technology, a related field, or an equivalent amount of related experience
• Experience leading major projects in collaboration with Product and Project teams
• Experience with legacy systems and integrating them with modern technologies
• Demonstrated ability to translate strategy into practical action
• Possess one or more certifications related to Cloud Technology
• Previous experience working in an FDA-regulated industry
